bioghist.p: John Francis Marion (1922-1991) was a literary agent, editor, and author. He worked as a promotional director for Lippincott and then as editor-in-chief at Chilton Book Company. In 1972 he began to devote himself exclusively to writing. He was the author of several books on Philadelphia, including Walking Tours of Historic Philadelphia (1974) and Within These Walls, a History of the Academy of Music in Philadelphia (1984).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of John Marion. Much of the correspondence is with English novelist March Cost. Other correspondents include authors Doris Langley-Levy Moore, N. Brysson Morrison, and T.J. Morrison. The collection also includes many of March Cost's working notebooks, handwritten and typed manuscripts, scrapbooks, and photos. In addition there are published editions of several of Merion's books, his editorial and business correspondence, clippings of reviews, research files, and photographs, a typescript of his biography of March Cost, and manuscripts by Annette Joelson.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
